alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 3:01PM MST until September 21 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MST/445 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Navajo and east central Coconino counties. * WHEN...Until 345 PM MST /445 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 256 PM MST /356 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated that the heaviest rain has moved out of the advisory area at this time, though more rain could move in over the next hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Keams Canyon Wash, Polacca Wash, Coyote Wash, Jeddito Wash, Bluebird Canyon Wash, Little Colorado River, Moenkopi Wash, Tse Chizzi Wash, Oraibi Wash, Wepo Wash, Saltwater Wash, Ha- whi-yalin Wash, Dinnebito Wash, Burnt Corn Wash and Tees Toh Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... First Mesa, Hard Rock, Tolani Lake, Shongopovi, Second Mesa, Kykotsmovi Village, Hopi Reservation, Hotevilla, Polacca, Navajo Reservation and Pinon. - This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 358 and 400. State Route 99 between mile markers 61 and 62. State Route 87 between mile markers 387 and 406. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
